title: Fiery Scherzer helps Jays tie up series with M's

content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

content: Dr Moore said that some of her most special and personal performances are with the robot, because she gets to explore her own memories and have conversations with people who may have passed away.

content: NDTV Global World Summit 2025 LIVE Updates: The 2025 edition of the NDTV World Summit - NDTV's flagship event - began on Friday, and will feature a host of leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: AQI Above 350 Today As Delhi Gears Up For Diwali Weekend
content: The Air Quality Index (AQI) in New Delhi continued to be in the "very poor" category on Friday morning, as the national capital gears up for the upcoming Diwali weekend with the festival of lights being celebrated on Monday.

title: Gujarat Cabinet Expansion Today, First Under Bhupendra Patel's Chief Ministership
content: Gujarat is set for a major cabinet expansion today, with Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel scheduled to meet Governor Acharya Devvrat and submit the list of new ministers.

title: Bomb Threat To Vice President CP Radhakrishnan's Chennai Home Turns Out To Be Hoax
content: A major security scare unfolded in Chennai on Thursday evening after an anonymous email claimed that a bomb had been planted at Vice President CP Radhakrishnan's residence in Mylapore.

title: Explained: How Australia's Social Media Ban For Kids Under 16 Will Work
content: From December 10, young teenagers in Australia will be banned, under new legislation, from social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram and TikTok - one of the toughest online crackdowns in the democratic world.

title: Thane Man Loses Rs 27 Lakh In Cryptocurrency Scam
content: A 40-year-old man from Maharashtra's Thane district lost about Rs 27 lakh in a cryptocurrency investment scam after falling for "high" returns, a police official said on Friday.

title: Man Arrested In Dehradun For Rs 46 Lakh Investment Fraud, Brought To Arunachal
content: A man was arrested in Dehradun by the Arunachal Pradesh Police for allegedly duping several people of Rs 46.27 lakh through a fake investment scheme and brought to the northeastern state, an officer said on Friday.

title: Karnataka Man Ties Up Mother, Slits Her Throat For Refusing To Give Money For Liquor
content: A horrific incident of a son tying up his mother and slitting her throat for refusing to give him money to buy liquor has come to light in the Bagalkot district of Karnataka on Friday.

title: Congress Leader At Centre Of PM Abuse Row Gets Bihar Ticket: Sources
content: The Congress is bracing for fresh controversy over its choice of candidate for the Jale constituency for the 2025 Bihar assembly elections. The party has fielded young leader Mohammad Naushad from Jale in Darbhanga district, sources said.

title: Shark Tank Judge Peyush Bansal Nears Billionaire Status With Lenskart IPO
content: Lenskart is planning to list as early as next month in Mumbai, targeting a stock debut that would value the company at $9 billion, based on the IPO size according to people familiar with the matter, and calculations from the prospectus.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Tamannaah Bhatia's Fake Voter IDs Surface Ahead Of Hyderabad By-Polls
content: Voter ID cards bearing the names, photographs and addresses of Telugu actors, including Rakul Preet Singh, Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Tamannaah Bhatia are circulating on social media.

title: Bangladeshi Trans Person 'Guru Maa' Arrested In Mumbai For Trafficking 200 People
content: The Mumbai Police on Thursday arrested a Bangladeshi trans person who had been living in India for the last 30 years using forged documents.

title: "India Could Play Dirty": Pakistan's Controversial Remarks On "Two Front War"
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif courted controversy by again linking India with Islamabad's wider tensions with Kabul.

title: "They Are In  Hurry To Set The Stage": Expert On Gujarat Cabinet Shake-Up
content: Gujarat is witnessing a significant cabinet reshuffle under Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel, with all 16 of the 17 ministers resigning ahead of the formal induction of the new lineup.

title: On Camera, Tiger Mauls Farmer In Karnataka, Villagers Climb Trees To Escape
content: A terrifying tiger attack in Badagalapura village, Saragur taluk in Mysuru district was caught on video, showing villagers desperately climbing trees to save themselves as the big cat charged at them in a field.

title: Bengaluru Business Corridor Announced, Promises To Cut Traffic By 40%
content: The government anticipates a 40 per cent reduction in city traffic once the Bengaluru Business Corridor is operational, as vehicles moving between highways and industrial zones will bypass the city core.

title: Sabarimala Sponsor Unnikrishnan Potti Arrested In Gold Theft Case
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) appointed by the Kerala High Court to probe the Sabarimala gold robbery case arrested the prime accused, Unnikrishnan Potti early Friday.

content: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) website was down on Friday (October 17, 2025)

content: Applications in Form-19, along with supporting documents, will be accepted during the drive at designated centres between 10 a.m. and 5.30 p.m.

content: As per the FIR, a rival group allegedly threatened and assaulted the 24 persons when they demanded some money from a deposit collected for a community conference

content: After receiving the case details registered by the Karur town police on September 27, the CBI team is expected to begin its investigation later on Friday

content: Child father was arrested after he attacked a doctor at Thamarasseri Taluk hospital alleging his negligence

content: The terrorists fled the spot after ‚Äúcarrying out speculative firing using automatic weapons‚Äù due to retaliation by the Army, said a Defence spokesperson

title: 208 Maoists to surrender today in Chhattisgarh with 153 weapons
content: On October 16, 2025, Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that 258 Maoists had surrendered in Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra over the past two days.

title: Political tempers flare up in the campaign for Odisha bypoll
content: Taking a dig at former CM Naveen Patnaik, Odisha CM Mohan Majhi accused him of making ‚Äòfalse promises during elections‚Äô and ‚Äòconveniently forgetting them once polls were over‚Äô

title: Cooperative network strengthened in Rajasthan with membership drive
content: Minister of State for Cooperative Gautam Kumar Dak said the PACS had organised 8,500 special camps for giving membership to the people in the rural areas

content: Speaking at the launch of the initiative Abhishek Banerjee said that Bengal, our beloved motherland, is being hounded, humiliated, maligned, and vilified by Bohiragoto Bangla-Birodhi Zamindars who thrive on lies and propaganda, increasingly in the digital space.

content: Rohit Pawar gave a presentation, citing examples of addition, deletion and duplication of voters in Maharashtra‚Äôs voter list

content: The Ministry has stated that it was in the process of formulating guidelines regarding the inclusion of disabled-friendly accessibility features for content on OTT platforms

content: A Special Public Prosecutor will be appointed for the purpose in consultation with the Advocate General, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

content: The accused had allegedly demanded ‚Çπ8.000 from a 73-year-old man to issue E-swathu (digital database of property ownership in rural areas)

content: A case was registered, and during the investigation, the cyber team traced the origin of the e-mail to a juvenile

content: This is in stark contrast to the recent statement of Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, who had expressed confidence of getting the necessary clearances, and that the DPR for the project would be prepared soon

content: A two-judge Bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Sinha and Judge Bibhu Datta Guru ruled that counter-insurgency measures undertaken by the State or Central Security forces, could not be subjected to investigation by the SIT unless exceptional circumstances warranted such intervention

content: The escalating row over political and religious lines eased on October 14, 2025 after the parent agreed to adhere to the rules and regulations prescribed by the management

content: ICE said its enforcement teams apprehended individuals convicted of serious crimes, including rape, child sexual abuse, and drug trafficking

content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan pleased with Air India‚Äôs decision to restore flight services from Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, enhancing air connectivity in Kerala

content: Commuters have been advised to avoid routes leading towards the Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Indoor stadium and use alternate roads

content: Election officials have urged the public not to believe or share unverified information concerning electoral rolls and have warned that strict action will be taken

content: The CBI seized jewellery weighing about 1.5 kg, keys of two luxury vehicles (Mercedes and Audi), 22 luxury watches, locker keys, 40 litres of imported liquor

content: Pop-up hair treatment camps and miracle regrowth schemes are preying on men‚Äôs insecurities, promising instant fixes but leaving a trail of burns, infections and empty wallets. Urban tragedy unfolds in Hyderabad as men fall prey to scams, revealing the emotional turmoil of baldness

content: Before formal arrest, the SIT escorted Mr. Potti to the General Hospital in Thiruvananthapuram for a detailed medical examination

title: Man dies of asphyxiation while cleaning septic tank in Ranipet
content: Police say that the victim did not respond¬†after he went inside the tank; two others who tried to save the victim fell unconscious. Both of them have been admitted at a private hospital

title: UN today still reflects realities of 1945, not of 2025; it must reform: EAM Jaishankar
content: The EAM underscored the need to "recalibrate" global peacekeeping efforts in tune with evolving realities

title: Durgapur gang rape case: Bengal has second-lowest conviction rate for crimes against women
content: Between 2017 and 2023, only around one in five cases of crimes against women ended in convictions in West Bengal

title: Indian peacekeepers carved special place for themselves, earned goodwill: President Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu praises Indian peacekeepers for their gender inclusion, community empowerment, and dedication to United Nations peacekeeping missions

title: Know thy villain | Review of The Menon Investigation by Saharu Nusaiba Kannanari
content: In this police procedural set in Kerala, male protagonists are the victims of an unjust patriarchal society

title: Candlelight before codification: 20 years of RTI Act
content: In Beawar, Rajasthan, the birthplace of the Right to Information movement, people reckon with a looming setback while celebrating 20 years of a historic law.¬†Aroon Deep¬†finds that even as groups from across India gather to rejoice at the citizen wins, they protest its erosion in several ways, especially by the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023

title: NDA will return to power in Bihar with thumping majority: Chhattisgarh CM
content: Vishnu Deo Sai said that Bihar has witnessed tremendous growth under the leadership of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

title: Digvijaya Singh alleges SIR aimed at 'vote theft', says INDIA bloc will protest with proof
content: Singh accused the BJP of having 62 lakh voters removed from the electoral rolls in Bihar to influence assembly elections. He asserted, however, that the alliance in Bihar would still form the government.

title: Cash, luxury watches & more: How bribe trap led CBI to IPS officer's opulent life
content: A senior IPS officer, Ropar Range DIG Harcharan Singh Bhullar, has been arrested by the CBI. He was apprehended at his Mohali office on bribery charges. An iron merchant had complained of a Rs 8 lakh demand to settle a case. The CBI also seized significant cash, jewellery, luxury watches, and property documents during searches.

title: India cut Russian oil imports by 50%? After Trump, White House makes big claim
content: Indian refiners are reportedly set to halve their Russian oil imports, a White House official stated. However, Indian sources suggest this reduction hasn't materialized yet, with December/January data expected to show any change. Meanwhile, the Ministry of External Affairs denied any recent conversation between PM Modi and US President Trump regarding this matter, emphasizing India's consumer-centric energy policy.

title: Delhi: Thar driver runs over teen twice; kills him
content: A 13-year-old boy, Murshid, was tragically killed after being allegedly run over twice by a Mahindra Thar in Vasant Kunj, Delhi. Eyewitnesses reported the SUV driver hit the boy on his bicycle and then reversed over him before fleeing the scene. The victim's family, living in a jhuggi, mourns his loss and seeks justice.

title: UP lynching case: Rahul meets Dalit victim's family; claims govt 'threatening' them
content: Rahul Gandhi visited the family of Hariom Valmiki, a Dalit man lynched in Raebareli. Gandhi alleged the government threatened the family against meeting him. He pledged Congress support for Dalits facing atrocities nationwide. Gandhi stated the family seeks justice and accused the government of obstructing their access to medical care and protection for perpetrators.

title: Total Chess World Championship Tour: No freestyle? No women's edition
content: FIDE has approved the "Total Chess World Championship Tour," a new format by Norway Chess, combining Fast Classical, Rapid, and Blitz to find the "Total Chess Player."  The tour, featuring four events annually with a $2.7 million prize pool, aims to innovate chess. A pilot event is set for autumn 2026, with the full season in 2027.

title: Salesforce CEO asks Anthropic CEO: Why are you still hiring engineers; Amodei replies
content: AI now crafts 90% of code for Anthropic teams, yet CEO Dario Amodei insists on retaining engineers. These professionals now focus on complex 10% tasks and supervising AI, boosting productivity tenfold. This trend, seen across startups, challenges entry-level developers while experienced ones remain secure, reshaping the tech landscape.

title: ‚ÄòYou are a pig Trump‚Äô: Hackers breach several airports in US, Canada
content: Public address systems and display screens at four North American airports were compromised, broadcasting pro-Hamas messages and anti-Trump sentiments. The cyberattacks targeted Harrisburg International Airport in Pennsylvania, and Windsor, Kelowna, and Victoria International Airports in Canada. While authorities deemed the overall disruption minimal, investigations are underway to address the security breach and its potential implications.

title: Nara Lokesh takes 'feeling the burn' jibe; Priyank Kharge hits back
content: Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh IT ministers are locked in a verbal spat over Google's proposed $15 billion AI data center. Karnataka's minister criticized Andhra Pradesh's substantial subsidies, deeming it an "economic disaster." Andhra's minister playfully retorted, suggesting Karnataka was feeling the "burn" of their successful investment attraction.

title: BCCI budget: Board expects to retain net surplus of 6700 crore
content: Hosting the Asia Cup will boost the BCCI's coffers by over Rs 100 crore, contributing to an expected net surplus of Rs 6700 crore for 2025-26. Despite a slump in IPL valuation, the board's surplus has grown significantly, though future growth may slow.  Expenditure on women's domestic cricket remains considerably lower than men's.

title: Most expensive divorce case yet: Relief for South Korean tycoon; top court steps in
content: South Korea's Supreme Court has sent back a massive $1 billion divorce settlement for SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won's estranged wife, Roh Soh-yeong, for review. The court deemed funds from Roh's father, a former president, as bribe money, thus ineligible for the settlement. This decision offers Chey immediate financial relief while the case awaits further deliberation.

title: After weak opening, Nifty soars above 25,750; Sensex up by over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday after days of strong rallying. While Nifty50 was below 25,550, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: CBSE practical exams 2025: Winter-bound school schedule out; check dates here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has announced the practical exam schedule for Classes 10 and 12 in winter-bound schools for the 2025‚Äì26 session. As per the circular, practical, project, and internal assessments will be held from November 6 to December 6, 2025. The schedule applies only to winter-bound schools; others will follow later dates.

title: Fact check: Did Virat Kohli sign a Pakistan jersey on reaching Perth?
content: A viral social media image falsely depicted Virat Kohli signing a Pakistan jersey. Fact-checking revealed the image was digitally altered; Kohli actually signed a Royal Challengers Bengaluru jersey for a fan in Perth, Australia. The Indian cricket team is currently in Perth preparing for their upcoming ODI and T20I series against Australia.

title: MacKenzie Scott cuts Amazon stake by 42%; now holds $12.6bn; prioritises equity work
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Rise and Fall winner: Arjun Bijlani lifts the trophy of the reality show
content: Pawan Singh's grand finale performance and Ashneer Grover's wit entertained fans, while Arjun Bijlani emerged victorious in the "penthouse and pace" reality show.  Bijlani's journey, marked by challenges and emotional moments, resonated with viewers who celebrated his inspiring and entertaining win on social media.

title: Hindu and Jewish leaders unite for seven-city US tour against rising hate
content: Hindu and Jewish leaders embarked on a seven-city US speaking tour to combat rising discrimination and strengthen interfaith ties. Organized by HinduACTion, the initiative provided practical tools to counter disinformation and marginalization, fostering dialogue and collaborative strategies between the communities.

title: Anesthesia murder: Kritika‚Äôs family donates her house for spiritual activities
content: Grief-stricken by their daughter Kritika's mysterious death, her family has donated their Bengaluru home to ISKCON, seeking peace and positive energy. The 28-year-old dermatologist's husband, a gastroenterologist, is under investigation after a post-mortem revealed anaesthesia in her system. He remains tight-lipped about the events leading to her demise.

title: 'Will fulfil all his dreams': 8-year-old son lights ASI Sandeep pyre
content: ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather, who died by suicide, was cremated in his native Julana town after his family demanded an FIR against named individuals. The FIR was lodged, leading to the postmortem and cremation attended by prominent political figures. His family expressed anguish, calling him wronged and demanding justice.

title: ‚ÄòUnhinged‚Äô wolf warrior: US treasury secy slams China‚Äôs trade negotiator
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent labelled a senior Chinese trade official 'unhinged' and a 'wolf warrior' for aggressive behaviour during what he claimed was an uninvited visit to Washington. China's Commerce Ministry refuted the claims, stating the visit aimed for discussions following presidential talks.

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Probe team arrests 'sponsor' Unnikrishnan
content: Sabarimala gold theft prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti has been taken into custody for detailed interrogation by a special investigation team. Investigators are probing the alleged handover of stolen gold to a Bengaluru-based man. The probe, which has a six-week deadline, is expected to reveal the exact quantity of misappropriated gold.

title: California at risk? Scientists warns an earthquake could strike and cause huge damage
content: A massive Pacific Northwest earthquake could trigger a devastating second quake on California's San Andreas Fault, a new study reveals. This challenges previous beliefs of fault independence, suggesting a dangerous domino effect. Such interconnected seismic activity poses significant risks to the US West Coast, underscoring the urgent need for enhanced preparedness and infrastructure.

title: Virat Kohli creates a heartwarming moment for young fan in Australia - watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are back in the ODI squad for the Australia tour, drawing significant fan attention. A young fan's ecstatic reaction to getting Kohli's autograph in Perth highlights their enduring impact. Both players showcased their legendary form in training, with this series potentially being their last in Australia.

title: Brewers ‚ÄòKaren‚Äô Shannon Kobylarczyk fired after racist rant at Dodgers fan veteran
content: A Wisconsin woman, Shannon Kobylarczyk, faced swift repercussions after a viral video captured her racist tirade against a U.S. war veteran at a baseball game. Her employer, ManPowerGroup, terminated her employment, and she resigned from the Make-A-Wish Foundation board. The incident highlights the rapid online response to displays of hate.

title: Another blackout in Ukraine: Russian drone & missile attack disrupts power in 8 regions
content: Russia unleashed a massive drone and missile assault, crippling Ukraine's power grid and plunging millions into darkness as winter looms. President Zelenskyy, en route to meet US President Trump, seeks advanced air defense and long-range missiles. Meanwhile, Ukraine targets Russian oil refineries, while a new aviation partnership with a US firm aims to bolster its defense industry.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages to light up the celebrations
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, is celebrated with great fervor, symbolizing hope, knowledge, and love. Families gather to share happiness, exchange gifts, and create lasting memories. The article provides 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to help express gratitude and spread joy during this auspicious occasion.

title: Bihar polls: Manoj Bajpayee calls out RJD's 'patched-up' clip; issues clarification
content: Padma Shri actor Manoj Bajpayee publicly denounced a manipulated campaign video falsely featuring him, shared by the RJD's IT cell. He clarified his non-affiliation with any political party, calling the clip a fake edit. The RJD later deleted the video, but the incident sparked political accusations and highlighted the ongoing high-voltage campaign for the Bihar assembly elections.

title: Mumbai: Commuter helps woman deliver baby on local train
content: A cinematographer, Vikas Bedre, became an unlikely hero when he delivered a baby boy on a Mumbai local train. Guided by a doctor friend over a video call, Bedre and co-passengers managed the emergency delivery after the train halted at Ram Mandir station. The mother and child are reported to be in good health.

title: Australia hit by injury! Green suffers side soreness; Labuschagne steps in
content: Cameron Green is out of the India ODI series with a minor side strain, replaced by in-form Marnus Labuschagne.  Cricket Australia is being cautious ahead of the Ashes.  This setback follows Green's return from spinal surgery.  Other Australian players are also managing injuries, with Jhye Richardson showing promising signs.

title: Last tour for Rohit and Virat? AB de Villiers and Hayden reflect on India stars
content: AB de Villiers and Matthew Hayden express their admiration for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's continued presence in Indian cricket. Both former cricketers highlighted the invaluable mentorship the duo provides, while acknowledging the inevitable end of their careers. They are focused on the 2027 World Cup, with Kohli's current Australian tour potentially being his last.

title: Bengaluru: 20-year-old BPharma student stabbed to death by ex-boyfriend
content: A 20-year-old B Pharmacy student was fatally stabbed near railway tracks in Srirampura by her former boyfriend, Vignesh, after she repeatedly rejected his attempts to reconcile. The victim had previously complained to police about Vignesh's harassment. Vignesh, who has a prior arrest for extortion, is currently at large.

title: Who is Shannon Kobylarczyk? Milwaukee Brewers fan controversy explained
content: A viral video from a Brewers-Dodgers game captured a Milwaukee attorney, Shannon Kobylarczyk, making a racially charged remark and threatening to call ICE on a U.S. Navy veteran. The incident led to Kobylarczyk's termination from her job, resignation from a charity board, and a ban from the stadium. The veteran, Ricardo Fosado, expressed sympathy for her.

title: Gold rates at record highs, hit $4,379.93/ounce; US credit & China woes fuel surge
content: Gold and silver have reached unprecedented levels. Investors are flocking to safe havens amid worries about US credit and escalating US-China friction. Federal Reserve rate cut expectations are also fueling this rally. Silver has surpassed its 1980 record. Palladium and platinum have also seen significant gains this week.

title: Rohit‚Äôs first interaction with Gambhir after stepping down as ODI captain - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma returns to action for India against Australia after stepping down as ODI captain, with Shubman Gill now leading the side.  Sharma was seen training intensely with coach Gautam Gambhir and batting alongside Virat Kohli, a nostalgic sight for fans. This tour could be a final appearance in Australia for the veteran duo.

title: Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs agriculture model wins praise from World Bank chief
content: World Bank President Ajay Banga lauded Uttar Pradesh's agriculture model for small farmers as a global benchmark for sustainable farming and climate adaptation. He highlighted the integration of climate-tolerant seeds, regenerative techniques, and digital technology as key to empowering farmers and ensuring financial inclusion.

title: 'Insufficient evidence': US appeals court blocks Trump's request to send National Guard to Chicago
content: A US appeals court has blocked President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard in Chicago, citing a lack of evidence for rebellion or danger. The court found that protests against immigration policies, even if spirited, do not justify such a deployment. This ruling follows similar challenges from Illinois, Oregon, and California against the administration's use of federal troops domestically.

title: Gabrielle Union celebrates father‚Äôs 81st birthday amid his life-threatening illness
content: Gabrielle Union celebrated her father's 81st birthday with a heartfelt Instagram message, expressing gratitude for their connection despite his ongoing battle with dementia. She shared touching moments, including his joy at seeing her and Dwyane Wade. Their daughter Kaavia also posted a touching tribute to her grandpa with an emotional post reflecting back to the time when she held his arms for first time.

title: Aaron Rodgers‚Äô secret wife Brittani sparks mystery over private marriage
content: Aaron Rodgers, now with the Steelers, keeps his wife Brittani a complete mystery. Despite his public return to football, no photos or public appearances of her exist, and even teammates haven't met her. Rodgers emphasizes her desire for privacy, stating she didn't sign up for celebrity life. He credits her with profoundly changing his world and being his unwavering support.

title: MLB rumors: Phillies target $54M Mets star to replace Kyle Schwarber
content: Philadelphia Phillies face a crucial offseason with Kyle Schwarber's free agency. Former GM Jim Bowden suggests targeting New York Mets star Pete Alonso as a logical replacement. Alonso offers durability, defensive versatility at first base, and is younger than Schwarber, making him an intriguing, albeit potentially costly, alternative if Schwarber departs.

title: All Mega Evolutions ranked in Pokemon Legends: Z-A ‚Äî full tier list
content: Pokemon Legends: Z-A has unveiled exciting new Mega Evolutions, transforming beloved creatures like Zygarde and Greninja into formidable forces. This tier list ranks these powerful forms based on battle prowess, accessibility, and strategic typing, offering players a guide to the game's most impactful transformations. Discover which Megas dominate the battlefield.

title: Pakistan in crisis! Captain Salman Agha sacked after Asia Cup losses to India - Report
content: Pakistan Cricket Board is set to replace Salman Ali Agha with Shadab Khan as T20I captain following three consecutive Asia Cup 2025 losses to India. This strategic reset ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup will be implemented once Shadab recovers from shoulder surgery next month.

title: West Bengal Congress submits demands to CEO for modification of SIR process
content: The WBPCC‚Äôs memorandum listed out 16-point demands like the inclusion of electoral rolls since 2002 till that of the Assembly election in 2021 as probative evidence of eligibility and citizenship of a voter¬†

title: Urban local bodies in Ernakulam achieve 80% coverage in doorstep waste collection by volunteers
content: Kochi Corporation and 13 municipalities in Ernakulam¬†achieve total coverage of 96% and 85% respectively in deployment of volunteers

title: HC slams slack cooperation between Centre and State in cleaning up Periyar
content: High Court orders competent authority at the Centre to hold talks with State Environment Secretary to find a viable solution to pollution of the river, including identifying an alternative site for effluent treatment

title: Russia confident of continuing energy trade with India: Deputy PM Novak
content: The U.S. president claimed that while India may not be able to cut the procurement immediately, the process has started.

title: Bid to politicise, give caste colour to Haryana IPS officer death case ‚Äòinappropriate‚Äô, says Union Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal
content: Justice will be delivered to both families, a ‚Äòsocial evil‚Äô central to the incidents, he says after meeting kin of ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather; last rites performed at Julana after post-mortem

content: When asked about the possibility of Mr. Raj Thackeray‚Äôs inclusion in the MVA, Mr. Sapkal said the delegation which had gone to meet the Election Commission had nothing to do with the allianc

title: Northeast monsoon sets in with intense rain forecast across Tamil Nadu till October 22
content: It marks an early onset, ahead of its usual date of October 20. The RMC has issued an orange alert for five districts today; Chennai will continue to experience light to moderate rainfall till October 18

title: Potholes cause chaos on road linking Medavakkam, Sholinganallur: residents
content: Traffic congestion caused by Metrorail work, haphazard parking of vehicles¬†on the narrow road and violation of road rules, they say. Former engineer dismisses possibility of widening the road

title: MSME Minister Kondapalli Srinivas visits Switzerland and Germany to explore industrial collaborations
content: He attends a series of high-level meetings and discusses areas of interest with CEOs of Fuchs Design AG and FyrstGen

title: Frequent jams around ORR spill on to connecting roads, make school travel a nightmare for children
content: The ripple effect of traffic from the Outer Ring Road, coupled with narrow lanes, has become a major concern for commuters on connecting roads, particularly for school buses, as vehicles crawl along these stretches every day during peak hours

title: Prime Minister Modi pats Andhra Pradesh for successful conduct of GST campaign¬†
content: In a post on X, he specially appreciated IT Minister Nara Lokesh for organising the campaign that deepened the understanding of reforms among youth

title: Days after hosting Taliban Foreign Minister, India says ‚Äòfully committed‚Äô to Afghan ‚Äòsovereignty and territorial integrity‚Äô
content: The statement is in the backdrop of cross-border clashes between Kabul and Islamabad earlier this week

title: Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs visit to lynching victim‚Äôs kin will reaffirm stand against injustice: Congress leader
content: Valmiki, the victim, was cornered by a mob who accused him of being a member of a gang marking houses with drones for theft; he was beaten with belts and sticks and died soon after

title: Russia backs AMCA programme, offers to make Su-57 jets in India
content: Following U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs claim that India will halt its oil purchase from Russia, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov says ‚ÄúRussian energy remains the most cost-effective option on the global market‚Äù

title: Government of India raised issue of anti-India rallies in Australia: Minister Anne Aly
content: ‚ÄúI want to reassure everyone that the divisive rhetoric expressed at the anti-migration rallies is not shared by the overwhelming majority of Australians,‚Äù says Ms. Aly

title: Experts bat for more space for social sector in mainstream media
content: Civil society and media representatives urge collaboration, training, and editorial focus to strengthen social sector coverage

title: Sri Lankan PM Harini Amarasuriya takes a trip down memory lane at her alma mater in Delhi, praising India‚Äôs diversity¬†
content: She studied at Hindu College in 1991, and urged current students to ‚Äúnever underestimate the power of asking difficult questions‚Äù; says India-SL partnersip is ‚Äúnot episodical‚Äù, but ‚Äústructural‚Äù

title: After hectic parleys, Mahagatbandhan manages to settle seat-sharing deal
content: As Vikassheel Insaan Party‚Äôs Mukesh Sahani played hardball and the Rashtriya Janata Dal remained intractable, the CPI(ML) and the Congress played peacemakers during the discussion for the seat distribution for the Bihar polls; VIP likely to get 15 seats; Congress announces list of 48 candidates for first and second phases

title: ‚ÄòDisproportionate growth‚Äô in assets of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey‚Äôs wife: Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate says there is ‚Äúno consistency‚Äù between Anamika Gautam‚Äôs declared income and assets over the years

title: Government targets ‚Çπ3 lakh crore in domestic defence production by 2029: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister says exports to touch ‚Çπ50,000 crore; credits private sector for driving India‚Äôs self-reliance push

title: JD(U), LJP(RV), and RLM release lists; NDA names all 243 candidates
content: The JD(U) has made a caste balance in the list giving maximum number to tickets to the OBC with 37 candidates, 22 candidates each belongs from Extremely Backward Classes and upper castes.

title: Pre-test for Census first phase to be held from November 10
content: Government notification provides option to self-enumerate; the order appears to imply the methodology to enumerate caste is not ready yet

title: Three technical glitches on¬†Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Yellow Line stretch in three months of launch
content: Responding to concerns about the repeated glitches, a senior official from the BMRCL says the problems were minor and not very serious

title: Women with metabolic syndrome face higher risk of gynaecological cancers, finds study
content: Metabolic syndrome is a complex cluster of metabolic disorders that includes obesity and hypertension among other conditions; the analysis found that the odds doubled for women with metabolic syndrome, when it came to certain cancers

title: Cabinet decides to procure entire paddy harvest, wait for legal opinion on  BC reservations
content: 50% local quota in NALSAR admissions and Committee on Metro Rail expansion are major Cabinet decisions

title: Tej Pratap carries photo of grandmother to file poll papers from Mahua
content: Ousted from the RJD for six years following a controversy, Tej Pratap Yadav has floated the Janshakti Janata Dal and has fielded 20 candidates till now for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Abujhmad, North Bastar regions free of Maoists: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister says 258 cadres surrendered in two days; government aiming to ‚Äúdecimate Naxalism before the 31st of March 2026‚Äù

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin
content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30¬∞C (86¬∞F) the weekend will peak at 34¬∞C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

title: AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the 2025-26 preseason women's college basketball AP Top 25 poll results are out . the reigning champion UConn Huskies top the list, with the rest of last season's final four -- the UCLA Bruins and Texas Longhorns round out the top four .

title: 10 players to put on your radar the rest of the season
content: Matt Bowen details why fantasy managers should keep an eye on Pat Bryant . it could be a rarely-used wide receiver making an impact play or a No. 2 tight end finding the end zone . create or join a fantasy basketball league on ESPN. Your championship run starts today! Sign up today!

title: Fowler and Graziano: Intel on Eagles and 49ers ahead of Week 7, plus looming trades
content: the "Get Up" crew reacts to the Titans' decision to fire coach Brian Callahan . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they also checked in on the aftermath of the firing of the coach . the 49ers' seemingly never-ending string of injuries have been reported .

title: Women's College Volleyball Bracketology: 2025 NCAA tournament predictions, bubble watch
content: the field of 64 is revealed on Nov. 30 (6 p.m. ET, ESPN) there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the rest of the bracket is filled out to balance it competitively and geographically .

title: WNBA mock draft: Betts, Fudd or Miles at No. 1?
content: the WNBA is negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement with the union . the draft lottery, expansion drafts for Toronto and Portland and a mammoth free agency will have to take place before the 2026 draft . five of our top six selections in this mock were eligible to go in the 2025 draft, but all opted to return for a return trip .

title: Haliburton magic, KD and Harden on Rockets trade: Takeaways from Season 2 of 'Starting 5'
content: the latest season of "Starting 5" was released Thursday . the series followed Oklahoma City Thunder guard Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . Kevin Durant fought through a midseason slump after limited action at the 2024 Paris summer Olympics .

title: Flacco finds vintage form as Bengals win battle of 40-something QBs
content: the Bengals beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 33-31 in an AFC North showdown . the Cincinnati Bengals traded for quarterback Joe Flacco . he threw for 342 yards and three touchdowns in the win .

title: 2026 class rankings: Missouri makes move with fall signings
content: the 2026 recruiting class remains in the top 25 after the dismissal of James Franklin . programs including Arkansas, UCLA and Oklahoma State have seen their classes fall apart in the wake of coaching changes . with overall success on the field, Missouri is starting to build success on a recruiting trail as well, with multiple commitments in October .

title: ‚ÄòGovt objection‚Äô: SC collegium tells reason for Justice Sreedharan‚Äôs transfer change
content: atul Sreedharan's name figured at the top of the list, specifying that he was being transferred from MP HC to Chhattisgarh HC . he would have been senior enough to be part of the HC collegium, and resolved to recommend his transfer to Allahabad .
